flawed_nl_solution:
If Evan had 200 books two years ago, he currently has 200-40 = <<200-40=106>>106 books.
In five years, Evan will have 60 more than 106*5 = 530 books which is the number he has now.
This means Evan will have 530+60 = <<530+60=590>>590 books in five years.
#### 590

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 160, not 106. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
